com.backEnd

Class DiffExCalc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.backEnd.DiffExCalc

  • public class DiffExCalc
extends java.lang.Object
    This class executes the differential expression calculator. it pre-processes all of the data and metadata files, then runs the DEseq2 script.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Agastya Sharma Date: July 14th, 2017

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> comps,
                        org.eclipse.swt.widgets.ProgressBar progressBar,
                        java.io.File runInfo,
                        org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Label label,
                        org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Text text)
        The main method contains the main algorithm that runs the R script.
        Parameters:
        args: - String[] that contains the data file/folder, metadata folder, and folder to put results files.
        comps: - all comparisons that need to be run with the data being passed to DESeq2
        progressBar: - the progress bar that is shown to the user
        runInfo: - run log file generated
        label: - text label showing the current running task
        text: - text box that shows complete history of run tasks

      • MatrixMaker

        public static void MatrixMaker(java.lang.String[] matrixForm,
                               java.util.ArrayList<GenesList> deMultiplexedMatrix,
                               java.io.File metafile,
                               java.io.File matrixFolder)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method makes the matrices required per metadata file. This way, even though the data matrix has all trials, it is not all passed through the DESeq2 program at once, thereby optimizing its run time.
        Parameters:
        matrixForm: - String[] showing what clones need to be in the matrix and in what order
        deMultiplexedMatrix: - matrix represented by an ArrayList of GenesLists, each one representing a column in the matrix.
        metafile: - metadata file.
        matrixFolder: - folder to put the made matrices into.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - caused by FileInputStream

      • getDiffIdx

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getDiffIdx(GenesList g,
                                                               java.io.File folder)
                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        This method calculates the differentiation index (a metric used to rank prospective clones-currently an unused function, as the differentiation index is no longer used.
        Parameters:
        folder: - of files (easch file conatins the counts and genes for a single clone)
        g: - GenesList of genes to be used to calculate the differentiation index
        Returns:
        ArrayList of differentiation indices (one per clone)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - caused by FileInputStream

      • getSigGenes

        public static GenesList getSigGenes(java.io.File sigGenes)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        This method gets all significant genes (genes having a fold change greater than a specified threshold) from a results file created by DESeq2. It returns the genes as a GenesList object. This method is currently not used, as this functionality was implemented within the R Script.
        Parameters:
        sigGenes: - File to be parsed
        Returns:
        GenesList of significant genes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - caused by FileInputStream

      • getSize

        public static int getSize(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> List2D)
        This method calculates the total number of elements in a 2D ArrayList. Example: if the ArrayList contains 3 other lists, each with 4 elements, this method return 12.
        Parameters:
        List2D: - List to get all elements from
        Returns:
        int number of elements
